info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN ANDERSON...SOUTHWESTERN PICKENS AND SOUTHEASTERN OCONEE COUNTIES UNTIL 1115 PM EDT... At 1044 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with torrential rainfall 6 miles southwest of Clemson, or 6 miles southwest of Pendleton. This storm was drifting slowly north. Locations to be impacted include... Clemson, Seneca, Central, Pendleton, Norris, Six Mile, Lake Hartwell, Lake Keowee, Townville, and Sandy Springs. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters. Lake Hartwell and Lake Keowee are in the path of this storm. Cloud to ground lightning and gusty winds will create dangerous boating conditions. ove to shore immediately.
